title: Keira Knightley flashes a huge smile as she steps out on a stroll with newborn baby daughter Delilah
text:
She's adjusting to life as a busy mother-of-two after welcoming a second daughter into the world last month.

And Keira Knightley looked as though parenting a newborn was suiting her well as she stepped out near her home in London with baby Delilah on Friday morning.

The actress, 34, flashed a huge smile and beamed from ear-to-ear while strolling through the city with her daughter strapped close to her chest in a Baby Bjorn carrier.

Plenty to smile about: Keira Knightley looked as though parenting a newborn was suiting her well as she stepped out near her home in London with baby Delilah on Friday morning

The Imitation Game star wrapped up against the chilly autumnal weather in a grey wool coat, which she teamed with a simple black dress.

The mother-of-two kept comfortable in a pair of black buckled boots and wore her brunette hair in loose waves.

Keira went make-up free for her low-key outing and accessorised with a pair of dark-framed glasses.

The talented actress kept Delilah close, with the newborn's red padded romper seen poking out from the carrier.

Oh baby: The actress, 34, flashed a huge smile and beamed from ear-to-ear while strolling through the city with her daughter strapped close to her chest in a Baby Bjorn carrier

Low-key look: The Imitation Game star wrapped up against the chilly autumnal weather in a grey wool coat, which she teamed with a simple black dress

Keira and her husband of six years, former Klaxons rocker James Righton, 36, confirmed the arrival of their second child last month when they were pictured out in London with their baby daughter.

The couple are also proud parents to daughter Edie, four.

Keira revealed she was pregnant for a second time in May when she debuted her bump at the Chanel J12 party in Paris, France.

The screen star and her musician husband have been together since early 2011, and married in May 2013 in an intimate ceremony in the South of France.

Keira has previously spoken of the challenges surrounding motherhood and juggling her acting career with caring for her daughters.

Happy days: The mother-of-two kept comfortable in a pair of black buckled boots and wore her brunette hair in loose waves

Off-duty beauty: Keira went make-up free for her low-key outing and accessorised with a pair of dark-framed glasses

Doting mother: The talented actress kept Delilah close, with the newborn's red padded romper seen poking out from the carrier

She told Balance magazine: 'I don't think we give women enough credit for the physical and emotional marathon they go through when becoming a mother.

'I come from a place of amazing privilege. I have an incredible support system; I’ve been unbelievably lucky in my career; I can afford good childcare, and yet I still find it really f***ing difficult.'

She added: 'It's OK to say that. It doesn't mean I don't love my kid, it's just me admitting that the sleep deprivation, the hormonal changes, the shift in relationship with my partner, are all things that make me feel as if I'm failing on a daily basis.

'I have to remind myself that I haven't failed, I'm just doing what I can do, but it’s not easy.'
description: The actress, 34, looked as though parenting a newborn was suiting her well as she stepped out near her home in London with baby Delilah on Friday morning.
